author: The Emporia Gazette
title: Waverly tops LCL VB Tourney
text:
Waverly tops LCL VB Tourney Madison finishes second, Olpe tops Lebo for third Jenny Grieder/Courtesy photo Makenna Farrow, Kendra Henry 
Madison’s Makenna Farrow tries to spike the ball past Waverly’s Kendra Henry (2) in Saturday’s Lyon County League Tournament. Jenny Grieder/Courtesy photo Waverly tops LCL VB Tourney The Emporia Gazette emporiagazette.com | 0 comments 
Waverly’s volleyball team cruised to first place at Saturday’s Lyon County League Tournament at White Auditorium, going 5-0 with all but one win requiring just two sets. 
Madison, which went 3-2, lost to Waverly in the championship, 25-15, 25-17, and in pool play (25-19, 25-11) for its only two losses. Madison topped Burlingame (26-24, 25-12) and Hartford (25-12, 25-15) to make it out of pool play, and followed it by knocking off Lebo (25-18, 25-15) to advance to the title match. 
Olpe finished second in its pool and third overall, beating Southern Coffey County in three sets (23-25, 25-8 and 25-19) to open play. 
The Eagles then bested Marais des Cygnes Valley, 25-14, 25-20, before losing in three sets to Lebo. The Wolves won the first set, 25-15, before dropping the next, 18-25. Lebo, which also beat MdCV (25-20, 25-18) and SCC (25-11,25-17), finished with a 25-22 win over Olpe to secure the first seed in its pool, though the two teams would meet again after losses in bracket play. 
In the third-place meeting, Olpe found the edge after dropping the first set, 13-25. The Eagles turned their play around in the final two, winning 25-12 and 25-17 to finish the day 3-2. 
Hartford went 0-3 in pool play, moving its season record to 6-23.
